title.narrative: N/A
N/A
Programa de Mejoramiento Vial
Road Improvement Program

description.narrative: El objetivo principal es mejorar la movilidad y la seguridad, ampliar la accesibilidad, disminuir los costos de transporte y reducir las tasas de accidentes, a traves de la mejora y el mantenimiento de carreteras.
The main objective is to enhance mobility and safety, improve accessibility, lower transport costs and reduce accident rates, through the improvement and maintenance of roads

activity-description.narrative: 55 Road Safety Officers were trained in Crash Investigation and Reconstruction in Dec. 2011. Main areas of course: Crush Energy/Damage Analysis & Lamp Examination; Rollover Accident & Multiple Crash Investigation; Heavy Vehicle Accident Reconstruction; Biomechanics: Occupant Kinematics & Forensics; Pedestrian/Bicycle Accident Reconstruction and Tyre Examination. This training will lead to more accurate examinations at crash sites, better road policies and an eventual decrease in road fatalities.

A guard rail is planted to reduce the incidents of vehicular and other traffic from accidentally straying into other areas. It is important in that it provides support and has the protective limitatiins of a bounday.

A pedestrian crossing outside the Queens School for girls. This is an imprtmat road marking especially at this juncture as it aids in the safe passage of children from one side of the street to the other.
A road sign alerting commuters of what lies ahead.

A section of the North Coast Highway in Portland that was retrofitted with safety signs signaling the speed limit. This is of special significance to the surrounding communities and schools that are along and off the main road as it will aid in the reduction of road fatalities due to speeding.
A stop sign erected to assist in regulating the flow of traffic and pedestrian safety in crossing the street.

A worker maintaining a section of the North Coast Highway. In areas that are close to towns and major cities, a greater emphasis is placed on the beautification of the road network corridor. In so doing, signs are always visible, alerting commuters to exercise greater caution on the roads.

An agreement was made with the National Solid Waste Management Authority (NSWMA) to manage the maintenance and the cleaning of a section of the North Coast Highway due to the fact that there were no registered CBO’s in the surrounding communities. Even with the presence of the NSWMA, citizens from the surrounding communities can still enjoy an increase in economic activities due to the vast improvement in transportation costs and travel time resulting from the road improvement.
Community Based Organisations (CBO's) maintaning the roadwway
In 2012, the Road Safety Unit engaged the services of three Data Entry Officers under the Road Improvement Programme to assist in reducing the backlog of traffic crash data.
Maintenance of the roadway by members of the surrounding communities
Martins – Ballard’s Valley, St. Mary roadway maintained using CBO's from surrounding communities.
Members of the surrounding communities benevelont groups assisting in the maintenance of the road network

Participants in the crash site investigation training learning how to accruately measure distance travelled and speed of vehicles in accidents. This training is of significance because it will help the crash site investigators to conduct more accurate investigations and make recommendations to put in place, measures that will assist in reduced road fatalities.
Sections of the road network have been retrofitted with signs to monitor the traffic flow and reduce road fatalities.
Traffic signals are installed to help regulate the flow of traffic in the busy commercial area and surrounding residential communities
Worker using a hand puch thermosplastic road marking machine. These markings are used to provide guidance and information to drivers and pedestrians.

Workers maintaining a section of the North Coast Highway - Clearing bushes and placing the garbage in bags. This is especially important as the burning of the debris would result in impaired vision of the commuting motorists and a possible increase in accidents.

Workers maintaining a section of the North Coast Highway, clearing away vegetation and debris. The reduction in high vegetation will enable road users to have a better view of the highway especially incoming traffic, possible pedestrians and signs.
Workers maintaining a section of the North Coast Highway.
